title: Food Wastage UI — Responsive prototype recreation with Add Food form variations

requirements.summary: Recreate the prototype’s overall responsive shell (green app bar, light content area, rounded cards, bottom navigation with Home/History).
acceptanceCriteria: UI includes a green header/app bar area similar to the screenshots (title aligned left or centered depending on screen).
UI includes a bottom navigation bar with Home and History tabs and clear active state styling.
Layouts look mobile-first and remain usable on desktop (centered phone-width container or responsive max width).

file_operations.description: Create the app root with a mobile-first layout wrapper (centered max-width container), top app bar, and persistent bottom navigation (Home/History) with clear active state; wire in routing to required screens. Use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., navigation buttons, layout containers) where appropriate—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a reusable layout component that renders the green header/app bar, scrollable content area, and fixed bottom navigation; ensure spacing so content isn’t hidden behind the bottom bar. Use shadcn-ui Button (and related components) for consistent interactions—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the bottom navigation with Home and History tabs, including icon + label styling and active state visuals matching the prototype. Use shadcn-ui Button for tab actions—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement the four screens (Home, Add Food, NGO Alert, History) and the prototype navigation flow between them.
acceptanceCriteria: Home screen shows: header 'Food Wastage Solution', 'Welcome, user!' and an 'Add Food' button, plus a 'Nearby NGOs' section with a map preview card.
Add Food screen shows: header 'Add Food', an image area, labeled inputs for Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and a prominent 'Post' button.
NGO Alert screen shows: header 'NGO Alert', a bold alert headline (e.g., 'Food donation received'), a short message, a map/route preview, and a 'Track' button.
History screen shows: header 'History' and a vertical list of items (e.g., Leftover pasta/Salad/Rice) with date/time and quantity aligned similarly to the screenshot.
Navigating via bottom tabs switches between Home and History; Home provides a way to reach Add Food; Add Food can navigate to NGO Alert after posting (UI flow can be simulated).

file_operations.description: Build the Home/Welcome screen structure and English text: title 'Food Wastage Solution', welcome message, 'Add Food' CTA, and 'Nearby NGOs' map preview card placeholder. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button for the CTA and card styling—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Build the Add Food screen base layout with header 'Add Food', image preview area, shared field model (Title, Quantity, Date, Time), and a prominent 'Post' action that can route to NGO Alert after submit. Use shadcn-ui Input/Button/Card to match prototype form styling—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Build the NGO Alert screen layout with header 'NGO Alert', bold alert headline, message text, route/map preview placeholder, and 'Track' button (demo-only). Use shadcn-ui Card/Button for consistent styling—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Build the History screen with header 'History' and a vertical list of posted items showing title, date/time, and quantity aligned similarly to the prototype. Use shadcn-ui Card (or List-like composition) to create rounded item rows—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire new pages into the app’s router and navigation: bottom tabs switch between Home and History; Home CTA navigates to Add Food; Add Food submit navigates to NGO Alert; ensure no extra top-level routes beyond the required screens.

requirements.summary: Provide multiple Add Food form variations (at least 3) with a UI control to switch between them and minimal validation.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 distinct Add Food form variations are available (e.g., single-page card form, multi-step wizard, and modal/drawer form), each containing Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and Submit/Post action.
A clear control (tabs/segmented control/dropdown) lets users switch between the form variations on the Add Food page.
All variations validate required fields at least minimally (e.g., empty Title/Quantity prevents submit and shows an inline error).

file_operations.description: Create the variation switch control for Add Food (e.g., tabs/segmented control) and render the currently selected variation. Use shadcn-ui Tabs (or equivalent) to provide the switcher UI—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement variation 1: single-page card form layout with labeled inputs (Title, Quantity, Date, Time) and a 'Post' button, matching prototype spacing and rounded inputs. Use shadcn-ui Input/Button/Card—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement variation 2: multi-step wizard (e.g., Step 1: Title/Quantity, Step 2: Date/Time) with Back/Next and final Post; include inline validation per step. Use shadcn-ui Button and progress/step styling via composition—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement variation 3: modal or drawer-based form that opens from the Add Food page, contains the same fields and Post action, and validates required fields. Use shadcn-ui Dialog or Sheet to provide modal/drawer behavior—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a small shared validation/helper hook for the required fields (Title, Quantity, Date, Time) and consistent inline error messages across all variations.
Integrate the form switcher and all three variations into the Add Food page, ensuring the user can switch variations and still submit the same underlying data.

requirements.summary: Add a lightweight client-side demo data model: posting adds to History and drives NGO Alert for most recent post (no real maps).
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting any Add Food variation adds an item to the History list (with title, date/time, quantity).
After posting, the app can show an NGO Alert screen for the most recent post (static demo message is acceptable).
No external map services are used; map sections are placeholders that still match the prototype layout.

file_operations.description: Create a small client-side store/context to hold posted food items in memory for the demo (add item, read list, read most recent).
Provide a React context/provider wrapping the app so Home/Add Food/History/NGO Alert can share demo data without a backend.
On successful validation + submit in any variation, add the new post to the demo store and navigate to the NGO Alert screen (simulated flow).
Read demo posts from the store and render them in the History list with title, date/time, and quantity.
Read the most recent demo post (if present) and display a sample alert message referencing it; keep map/route area as a static placeholder image (no external services).
Wrap the routed UI with FoodPostsProvider so all required screens share the same demo data model.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent eco-focused theme (green primary, neutral background, rounded corners, subtle shadows, consistent typography) across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI color is green and consistently applied to headers and primary buttons.
Cards, lists, and inputs use consistent spacing, border radius, and shadow across pages.
Typography hierarchy is consistent (screen title > section title > body text).

file_operations.description: Create global styles and theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn-ui) to set green primary, neutral background, and consistent radius/shadows; ensure typography defaults are simple and consistent across screens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the header/app bar and primary CTAs consistently use the green primary color and match the prototype’s spacing and rounded styling. Use shadcn-ui components for consistent styling where applicable—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align Home screen typography hierarchy, card styling, and spacing to the eco theme (rounded cards, subtle shadows, neutral background). Use shadcn-ui Card/Button—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align Add Food screen visuals (inputs/cards/button prominence) to the eco theme and keep consistent spacing across variations. Use shadcn-ui Input/Button/Card—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Align History list item rows/cards with consistent radius, shadow, and typography to match the prototype. Use shadcn-ui Card—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align NGO Alert screen typography and card/button styling to the eco theme; ensure 'Track' is clearly a primary action. Use shadcn-ui Button/Card—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add required generated images as static assets and use them for the food preview and map placeholders in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: All images listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Add Food uses the provided food placeholder image in the image preview area.
Home and NGO Alert screens use the provided map placeholder images in their map preview areas.

file_operations.description: Add the required generated asset: Minimal map placeholder card background with faint streets and two red location pins.
Add the required generated asset: Minimal map placeholder with a curved route line between two pins.
Add the required generated asset: Food bowl/plate photo-style placeholder on neutral background.
Add the required generated asset: Simple eco/leaf app logo icon, flat style, green tones.
Wire the static map image frontend/public/assets/generated/map-placeholder-home.dim_900x600.png into the 'Nearby NGOs' preview card area; keep it as a placeholder (no external map services).
Wire the static food image frontend/public/assets/generated/food-placeholder.dim_900x600.png into the image preview area at the top of the Add Food screen.
Wire the static route/map image frontend/public/assets/generated/map-placeholder-route.dim_900x600.png into the NGO Alert map/route preview area; keep it as a placeholder (no external map services).
Use the static logo frontend/public/assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header/app bar (e.g., alongside the title) to match eco branding.
